name: Abyssal Wretch
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The adult kruthik has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The adult kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the adult kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kruthik makes two stab attacks or two spike attacks.

actions.name: Stab
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spike
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The adult oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the adult oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The adult oblex's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3/day: charm person (as 5th-level spell), color spray, detect thoughts, hold person (as 3rd-level spell)

traits.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the oblex can extrude a  piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 1d4 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. For all practical purposes, the simulacrum is the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The slimy tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex's main body and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oblex makes one pseudopod attack and uses Eat Memories.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) psychic damage.

actions.name: Eat Memories
actions.desc:
The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, oozes, plants, and undead succeed on the save automatically. 
While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends. 
When an oblex causes a target to become memory drained, the oblex learns all the languages the target knows and gains all its proficiencies, except for any saving throw proficiencies.

name: Armanite
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The armanite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The armanite's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The armanite makes three attacks: one with its hooves, one with its claws, and one with its serrated tail.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Serrated Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Lance (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The armanite looses a bolt of lightning in a line 60 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Amnizu
damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the amnizu's darkvision.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The amnizu's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: charm person, command
3/day: dominate person, fireball
1/day: dominate monster, feeblemind

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The amnizu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The amnizu uses Poison Mind. It also makes two attacks: one with its whip and one with its Disruptive Touch.

actions.name: Taskmaster Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 33 (6d10) force damage.

actions.name: Disruptive Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 44 (8d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Poison Mind
actions.desc: The amnizu targets one or two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and be blinded until the start of the amnizu's next turn.

actions.name: Forgetfulness (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The amnizu targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. A stunned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is stunned for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, or learned during the last 5 hours.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm
reactions.desc: When a creature within 60 feet of the amnizu makes an attack roll against it, and another creature is within the attack's range, the attacker must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including the amnizu or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. If the saving throw it successful, the attacker is immune to the amnizu's Instinctive Charm for the next 24 hours.

name: Autumn Eladrin
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Enchanting Presence
traits.desc:
Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Enchanting Presence for 24 hours.
Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The eladrin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: charm person, sleep
3/day: cure wounds (as a 5th-level spell), lesser restoration
1/day: greater restoration, heal, raise dead

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

name: Astral Dreadnought
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.desc: The astral dreadnought's opened eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the dreadnought decides which way the cone faces. The cone doesn't function while the dreadnought's eye is closed or while the dreadnought is blinded.

traits.name: Astral Entity
traits.desc: The astral dreadnought can't leave the Astral Plane, nor can it be banished or otherwise transported out of the Astral Plane.

traits.name: Demiplanar Donjon
traits.desc: Any creature or object that the astral dreadnought swallows is transported to a demiplane that can be entered by no other means except a wish spell or this creature's Donjon Visit ability. A creature can leave the demiplane only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the plane shift spell. The demiplane resembles a stone cave roughly 1,000 feet in diameter with a ceiling 100 feet high.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the astral dreadnought fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The astral dreadnought's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Sever Silver Cord
traits.desc: If the astral dreadnought scores a critical hit against a creature traveling through the Astral Plane by means of the astral projection spell, the dreadnought can cut the creature's silver cord instead of dealing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The astral dreadnought makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (5d10 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a creature of Huge size or smaller and this damage reduces it to 0 hit points or it is incapacitated, the astral dreadnought swallows it. The swallowed target, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, appears in an unoccupied space on the floor of the astral dreadnought's Demiplanar Donjon.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) slashing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The astral dreadnought makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Donjon Visit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One creature that is Huge or smaller that the astral dreadnought can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or be magically teleported to an unoccupied space on the floor of the astral dreadnought's Demiplanar Donjon. At the end of the target's next turn, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Projection (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the astral dreadnought must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage as a successful one.

name: Bael
damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Dreadful
traits.desc: Bael can use his bonus action to appear dreadful until the start of his next turn. Each creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 10 feet of Bael must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Bael's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). Bael can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing appearance), animate dead, charm person, detect magic, inflict wounds (as an 8th-level spell), invisibility (self only), major image
3/day: counterspell, dispel magic, fly, suggestion, wall of fire
1/day: dominate monster, symbol (stunning only)

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Bael fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Bael has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Bael's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Bael regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Bael dies only if he starts his turn and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Bael makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Hellish Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Infernal Command
actions.desc: Each ally of Bael's within 60 feet of him can't be charmed or frightened until the end of his next turn.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Bael magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary_actions.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Bael attacks once with his hellish morningstar.

legendary_actions.name: Awaken Greed
legendary_actions.desc: Bael casts charm person or major image.

legendary_actions.name: Infernal Command
legendary_actions.desc: Bael uses his Infernal Command action.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Bael uses his Teleport action.

name: Allip
damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The allip can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

actions.name: Maddening Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

actions.name: Whispers of Madness
actions.desc: The allip chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 7 (1d8 + 3) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee attack against one creature of the allip's choice that the allip can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

actions.name: Howling Babble (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Each creature within 30 feet of the allip that can hear it must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage, and it is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

name: Alkilth
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The alkilth can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the alkilth is motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary slime or fungus.

traits.name: Forment Madness
traits.desc:
Any creature that isn't a demon that starts its turn within 30 feet of the alkilth must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, or it hears a faint buzzing in its head for a moment and has disadvantage on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.
If the saving throw against Forment Madness fails by 5 or more, the creature is instead subjected to the confusion spell for 1 minute (no concentration required by the alkilth). While under the effect of that confusion, the creature is immune to Forment Madness.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The alkilth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The alkilth makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) acid damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the balhannoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The balhannoth makes a bite attack and up to two tentacle attacks, or it makes up to four tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) and is moved up to 5 feet toward the balhannoth. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the balhannoth can't use this tentacle against other targets. The balhannoth has four tentacles.

legendary_actions.name: Bite Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The balhannoth makes one bite attack against one creature it has grappled.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: The balhannoth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying and any creatures it has grappled, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Vanish
legendary_actions.desc: The balhannoth magically becomes invisible for up to 10 minutes or until immediately after it makes an attack roll.

traits.name: Spectral Duplicate (1/Rest)
traits.desc:
As a bonus action, the berbalang creates one spectral duplicate of itself in an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it. While the duplicate exists, the berbalang is unconscious. A berbalang can have only one duplicate at a time. The duplicate disappears when it or the berbalang drops to 0 hit points or when the berbalang dismisses it (no action required).
The duplicate has the same statistics and knowledge as the berbalang, and everything experienced by the duplicate is known by the berbalang. All damage dealt by the duplicate's attacks is psychic damage.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The berbalang's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: speak with dead
1/day: plane shift (self only)

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The berbalang makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

name: Black Abishai
damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The abishai's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the abishai can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes three attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its bite.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage.

actions.name: Creeping Darkness (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The abishai casts darkness at a point within 120 feet of it, requiring no components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability for this spell. While the spell persists, the abishai can move the darkness up to 60 feet as a bonus action.

name: Air Elemental Myrmidon
damage_resistances: lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
languages: Auran, one language of its creator's choice

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The air elemental myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes three melee attacks.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes one flail attack. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 18 (4d8) lightning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the myrmidon’s next turn.

name: Blue Abishai
damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The abishai's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The abishai is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The abishai has the following wizard spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): friends, mage hand, message, minor illusion, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, disguise self, expeditious retreat, magic missile, charm person, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): darkness, mirror image, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, fear, lightning bolt
4th level (3 slots): dimension door, greater invisibility, ice storm
5th level (2 slots): cone of cold, wall of force
6th level (1 slots): chain lightning
7th level (1 slots): teleport

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes two attacks: one with its quarterstaff and one with its bite.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) lightning damage.

name: Boneclaw
damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
languages: Common plus the main language of its master

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: While its master lives, a destroyed boneclaw gains a new body in 1d10 hours, with all its hit points. The new body appears within 1 mile of the boneclaw's master.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the boneclaw can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The boneclaw makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shadow Jump
actions.desc:
If the boneclaw is in dim light or darkness, each creature of the boneclaw's choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 34 (5d12 + 2) necrotic damage.
The boneclaw then magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can bring one creature it's grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination. The destination spaces of this teleportation must be in dim light or darkness.

reactions.name: Deadly Reach
reactions.desc: In response to a visible enemy moving into its reach, the boneclaw makes one claw attack against that enemy. If the attack hits, the boneclaw can make a second claw attack against the target.

name: Bronze Scout
damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning; piercing; slashing; from non-magical attacks that aren't adamantine
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Earth Armor
traits.desc: The bronze scout doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it burrows.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The bronze scout has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Flare (1/Rest)
actions.desc: Each creature in contact with the ground within 15 feet of the bronze scout must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Bulezau
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Rotting Presence
traits.desc: When any creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more bulezaus, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 necrotic damage plus 1 necrotic damage for every bulezau within 30 feet of it.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The bulezau's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The bulezau has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Barbed Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease ends. While poisoned in this way, the target sports festering boils, coughs up flies, and sheds rotting skin, and the target must repeat the saving throw every 24 hours that elapse. On a successful save, the disease ends. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 4 (1d8). The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

traits.name: Aberrant Quickness (1/Rest)
traits.desc: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

traits.name: Boneless
traits.desc: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The choker makes two tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

traits.name: Corpses
traits.desc:
When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine dead humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.
While it has at least one humanoid corpse in its body, the corpse flower can use a bonus action to do one of the following:
• The corpse flower digests one humanoid corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Nothing of the digested body remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.
• The corpse flower animates one dead humanoid in its body, turning it into a zombie. The zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see the Stench of Death trait).

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Stench of Death
traits.desc: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, unless the creature is a construct or undead. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated until the end of the turn. Creatures that are immune to poison damage or the poisoned condition automatically succeed on this saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the stench of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The corpse flower makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Harvest the Dead
actions.desc: The corpse flower grabs one unsecured dead humanoid within 10 feet of it and stuffs the corpse into itself, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying. The remains can be used with the Corpses trait.

name: Deathlock
damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks that aren't silvered
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The deathlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The deathlock is a 5th-level spellcaster. The deathlock's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The deathlock has the following warlock spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast, mage hand
3rd level (2 slots): arms of Hadar, dispel magic, hunger of Hadar, invisibility, spider climb

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Deathly Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

name: Cadaver Collector
damage_immunities: necrotic; poison; psychic; bludgeoning; piercing; slashing; from non-magical attacks that aren't adamantine
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cadaver collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Summon Specters (1/Rest)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the cadaver collector calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; 1d6 specters (without Sunlight Sensitivity) arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of the cadaver collector. The specters act right after the cadaver collector on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the cadaver collector is destroyed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cadaver collector makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The cadaver collector releases paralyzing gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

name: Canoloth
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Dimensional Lock
traits.desc: Other creatures can't teleport to or from a space within 60 feet of the canoloth. Any attempt to do so is wasted.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The canoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The canoloth's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Uncanny Senses
traits.desc: The canoloth can't be surprised while it  isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The canoloth makes two attacks: one with its tongue or its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15), pulled up to 30 feet toward the canoloth, and restrained until the grapple ends. The canoloth can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

name: Deathlock Mastermind
damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks that aren't silvered
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The deathlock mastermind's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The deathlock mastermind is a 10th-level spellcaster. The deathlock mastermind's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The deathlock mastermind has the following warlock spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray
5th level (2 slots): arms of Hadar, blight, counterspell, crown of madness, darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, hold monster, invisibility

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Deathly Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or become restrained as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A restrained target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Dire Troll
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The dire troll has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, it regains only 5 hit points at the start of its next turn. The troll dies only if it is hit by an attack that deals 10 or more acid or fire damage while the troll has 0 hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind of Claws (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Each creature within 10 feet of the troll must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Deathlock Wight
damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks that aren't silvered
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The deathlock wight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor
1/day: fear, hold person, misty step

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the deathlock wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wight attacks twice with its Grave Bolt.

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this reduction reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

name: Dhergoloth
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The dhergoloth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 10, +2 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: darkness, fear
3/day: sleep

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dhergoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The dhergoloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dhergoloth makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Flailing Claws (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dhergoloth moves up to its walking speed in a straight line and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The dhergoloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

name: Drow Arachnomancer
damage_resistances: poison
languages: Elvish, Undercommon, can speak with spiders

traits.name: Change Shape (1/Rest)
traits.desc: The drow can use a bonus action to magically polymorph into a giant spider, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It can speak and cast spells while in giant spider form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying while in humanoid form melds into the giant spider form. It can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. It reverts to humanoid form if it dies.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights
1/day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow arachnomancer is a 16th-level spellcaster. The drow arachnomancer's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The drow arachnomancer has the following warlock spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast, mage hand, poison spray
5th level (3 slots): conjure animals, crown of madness, dimension door, dispel magic, fear, fly, giant insect, hold monster, insect plague, invisibility, vampiric touch, web, witch bolt
1/day each: dominate monster, etherealness, eyebite

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The drow arachnomancer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow arachnomancer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The drow arachnomancer ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two poisonous touch attacks or two bite attacks. The first of these attacks that hits each round deals an extra 26 (4d12) poison damage to the target.

actions.name: Poisonous Touch (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (8d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Bite (Giant Spider Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 26 (4d12) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces a target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

actions.name: Web (Giant Spider Form Only; Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

traits.name: Battle Command
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the drow targets one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. If the target can see or hear the drow, the target can use its reaction to make one melee at-tack or to take the Dodge or Hide action.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow house captain's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights
1/day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three attacks: two with his scimitar and one with his whip or his hand crossbow.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is an ally, it has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

traits.name: Discern Lie
traits.desc: The drow knows when she hears a creature speak a lie in a language she knows.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow inquisitor has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow inquisitor to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow inquisitor's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights, detect magic
1/day: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, levitate (self only), suggestion

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow inquisitor is a 12th-level spellcaster. The drow inquisitor's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The drow inquisitor has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): guidance, message, poison spray, resistance, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): bane, cure wounds, inflict wounds
2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, silence, spiritual weapon
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, dispel magic, magic circle
4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination, freedom of movement
5th level (2 slots): contagion, dispel evil and good, insect plague
6th level (1 slots): harm, true seeing

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow inquisitor has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three death lance attacks.

actions.name: Death Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amout equal to the necrotic damage it takes. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Variant: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow attempts to magically summon a yochlol, with a 50 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the drow takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow favored consort has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow favored consort to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow favored consort's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights
1/day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow favored consort is a 11th-level spellcaster. The drow favored consort's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The drow favored consort has the following wizard spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): mage hand, message, poison spray, shocking grasp, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, mage armor, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, invisibility, misty step, shatter
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, haste
4th level (3 slots): dimension door, Otiluke's resilient sphere
5th level (2 slots): cone of cold
6th level (1 slots): chain lightning

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow favored consort has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: War Magic
traits.desc: When the drow uses its action to cast a spell, it can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) poison damage. In addition,  the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell the drow casts before the end of the drow's next turn.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow matron mother has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow matron mother to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow matron mother's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights, detect magic
1/day: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, levitate (self only), suggestion

traits.name: Lolth's Fickle Fervor
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the matron can bestow the Spider Queen's blessing on one ally she can see within 30 feet of her. The ally takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage but has advantage on the next attack roll it makes until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The drow matron mother has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow matron mother is a 20th-level spellcaster. The drow matron mother's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The drow matron mother has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): bane, command, cure wounds, guiding bolt
2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance, dispel magic, spirit guardians
4th level (3 slots): banishment, death ward, freedom of movement, guardian of faith
5th level (2 slots): contagion, flame strike, geas, mass cure wounds
6th level (1 slots): blade barrier, harm
7th level (1 slots): divine word, plane shift
8th level (1 slots): holy aura
9th level (1 slots): gate

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow matron mother has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The matron mother makes two demon staff attacks or three tentacle rod attacks.

actions.name: Demon Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage. In addition, the target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the drow for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tentacle Rod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is hit three times by the rod on the one turn, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects for 1 minute: the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't take reactions. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Summon Servant (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow magically summons a retriever or a yochlol. The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

legendary_actions.name: Demon Staff
legendary_actions.desc: The drow makes one attack with her demon staff.

legendary_actions.name: Compel Demon (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: An allied demon within 30 feet of the drow uses its reaction to make one attack against a target of the drow's choice that she can see.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 1-3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The drow expends a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, or 3rd-level spell that she has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow shadowblade has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow shadowblade to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow shadowblade's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights
1/day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

traits.name: Shadow Step
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the drow can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow shadowblade has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two attacks with his shadow sword. If either attack hits, and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of darkness created by the shadow sword on a previous turn, the drow can dismiss that darkness and cause the target to take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. The drow can dismiss darkness in this way no more than once per turn.

actions.name: Shadow Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and 10 (3d6) poison damage. The drow can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage of if another creature takes an action to shake it.

actions.name: Variant: Summon Shadow Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow attempts to magically summon a shadow demon with a 50 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the drow takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of it summoner, acts as an ally of its summer, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The duergar despot's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: mage hand, minor illusion
1/day: counterspell, misty step, stinking cloud

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The duergar despot has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Psychic Engine
traits.desc: When the duergar despot suffers a critical hit or is reduced to 0 hit points, psychic energy erupts from its frame to deal 14 (4d6) psychic damage to each creature within 5 feet of it.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar despot has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The despot makes two iron fist attacks and two stomping foot attacks. It can replace up to four of its attacks with uses of its Flame Jet.

actions.name: Iron Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must make a successful DC 17 Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 30 feet away in a straight line. The target lands prone and then takes 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Stomping Foot
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, or 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage to a prone target.

actions.name: Flame Jet
actions.desc: The duergar spews flames in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Duergar Hammerer
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Engine of Pain
traits.desc: Once per turn, a creature that attacks the hammerer can target the duergar trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 5 (1d10) damage to the hammerer, and the hammerer can respond by using its Multiattack as a reaction.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: the duergar hammerer deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hammerer makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its hammer.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

name: Duergar Mind Master
damage_resistances: poison

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar mind master has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar mind master has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes two melee attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a use of Mind Mastery.

actions.name: Mind-Poison Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) poison damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, or 1 piercing damage and 14 (4d6) psychic damage while reduced.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it casts a spell, it uses its Reduce, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

actions.name: Mind Mastery
actions.desc: The duergar targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw, or the duergar causes it to use its reaction either to make one weapon attack against another creature the duergar can see or move up to 10 feet in a direction of the duergar's choice. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

actions.name: Reduce (1/Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically decreases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While reduced, the duergar is Tiny, reduces its weapon damage to 1, and makes attacks, checks, and saving throws with disadvantage if they use Strength. It gains a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and a +5 bonus to its AC. It can also take a bonus action on each of its turns to take the Hide action.

name: Duergar Warlord
damage_resistances: poison

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar warlord has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar warlord has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes three hammer or javelin attacks and uses Call to Attack, or Enlarge if it is available.

actions.name: Psychic-Attuned Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage while enlarged, plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage in melee, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Call to Attack
actions.desc: Up to three allied duergar within 120 feet of this duergar that can hear it can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

actions.name: Enlarge (1/Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically transforms in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it casts a spell, it uses Enlarge, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

reactions.name: Scouring Instruction
reactions.desc: When an ally that the duergar can see makes a d20 roll, the duergar can roll a d6 and the ally can add the number rolled to the d20 roll by taking 3 (1d6) psychic damage. A creature immune to psychic damage can't be affected by Scouring Intrusion.

name: Dybbuk
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The dybbuk can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The dybbuk's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dimension door
3/day: fear, phantasmal force

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dybbuk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Violate Corpse
traits.desc: The dybbuk can use a bonus action while it is possessing a corpse to make it do something unnatural, such as vomit blood, twist its head all the way around, or cause a quadruped to move as a biped. Any beast or humanoid that sees this behavior must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dybbuk for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its save is immune to Violate Corpse for 24 hours.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is also reduced by 3 (1d6). This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces it hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Possess Corpse (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
The dybbuk disappears into an intact corpse it can see within 5 feet of it. The corpse must be Large or smaller and that of a beast or a humanoid. The dybbuk is now effectively the possessed creature. Its type becomes undead, though it now looks alive, and it gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the corpse's hit point maximum in life.
While possessing the corpse, the dybbuk retains its hit points, alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, telepathy, and immunity to poison damage, exhaustion, and being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's game statistics, gaining access to its knowledge and proficiencies but not its class features, if any.
The possession lasts until the temporary hit points are lost (at which point the body becomes a corpse once more) or the dybbuk ends its possession using a bonus action. When the possession ends, the dybbuk reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse.

name: Earth Elemental Myrmidon
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
languages: Terran, one language of its creator's choice

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The earth elemental myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes two maul attacks.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Thunderous Strike (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes one maul attack. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 16 (3d10) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Eidolon
damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sacred Animation (Recharge 5-6)
traits.desc: When the eidolon moves into the space occupied by a sacred statue, the eidolon can disappear, causing the statue to become a creature under the eidolon's control. The eidolon uses the sacred statue's statistics in place of its own.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Divine Dread
actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the eidolon that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature must take the Dash action and move away from the eidolon by the safest available route at the start of each of its turns, unless there is nowhere for it to move, in which case the creature becomes stunned until it can move again. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any eidolon's Divine Dread for 24 hours.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The elder oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the elder oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The elder oblex's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: charm person (as a 5th-level spell), detect thoughts, hold person
3/day: confusion, dimension door, dominate person, fear, hallucinatory terrain, hold monster, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

traits.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the oblex can extrude a  piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 2d6 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. For all practical purposes, the simulacrum is the oblex, meaning the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The slimy tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex's main body and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elder oblex makes two pseudopod attacks and uses Eat Memories.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Eat Memories
actions.desc:
The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or take 44 (8d10) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, oozes, plants, and undead succeed on the save automatically. 
While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and sub-tract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends. 
When an oblex causes a target to become memory drained, the oblex learns all the languages the target knows and gains all its proficiencies, except any saving throw proficiencies.

name: Duergar Screamer
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Engine of Pain
traits.desc: Once per turn, a creature that attacks the screamer can target the duergar trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 11 (2d10) damage to the screamer, and the screamer can respond by using its Multiattack with its reaction.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The screamer makes one drill attack and uses its Sonic Scream.

actions.name: Drill
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sonic Scream
actions.desc: The screamer emits destructive energy in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or take 7 (2d6) thunder damage and be knocked prone.

name: Elder Tempest
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Air Form
traits.desc: The tempest can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The tempest doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the tempest fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Living Storm
traits.desc:
The tempest is always at the center of a storm 1d6 + 4 miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. 
In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. The winds extinguish open flames and disperse fog.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The tempest deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The tempest makes two attacks with its thunderous slam.

actions.name: Thunderous Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) thunder damage.

actions.name: Lightning Storm (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: All other creatures within 120 feet of the tempest must each make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also stunned until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The tempest moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Lightning Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The tempest can cause a bolt of lightning to strike a point on the ground anywhere under its storm. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Screaming Gale (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The tempest releases a blast of thunder and wind in a line that is 1 mile long and 20 feet wide. Objects in that area take 22 (4d10) thunder damage. Each creature there must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) thunder damage and be flung up to 60 feet in a direction away from the line. If a thrown target collides with an immovable object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown before impact. If the target would collide with another creature instead, that other creature must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

name: Fire Elemental Myrmidon
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks
languages: Ignan, one language of its creator's choice

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The myrmidon sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light in a 40-foot radius.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The fire elemental myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Water Susceptibility
traits.desc: For every 5 feet the fire elemental myrmidon moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 (1d4) cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fiery Strikes (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 (1d10) fire damage.

traits.name: Burning Fury
traits.desc: When the salamander takes fire damage, its Freezing Breath automatically recharges.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The salamander makes five attacks: four attacks with its claws and one with its bite.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) cold damage.

actions.name: Freezing Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The salamander exhales chill wind in a  60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a  successful one.

name: Geryon
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, from non-magical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Geryon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). Geryon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, geas, ice storm, invisibility (self only), locate object, suggestion, wall of ice
1/day: divine word, symbol (pain only)

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Geryon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Geryon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Geryon's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Geryon regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Geryon dies only if he starts his turn and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Geryon makes two attacks: one with his claws and one with his stinger.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (DC 24) and restrained until the grapple ends. If the target is already grappled by Geryon, the target takes an additional 27 (6d8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d4 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take 13 (2d12) poison damage and be poisoned until it finishes a short or long rest. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the poison damage it takes. If it hit point maximum drops to 0, it dies. This reduction lasts until the poisoned condition is removed.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Geryon magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

actions.name: Variant: Sound the Horn (1/Day)
actions.desc: Geryon blows his horn, which causes 5d4 minotaurs to appear in unoccupied spaces of his choice within 600 feet of him. The minotaurs roll initiative when they appear. They remain until they die or Geryon uses an action to dismiss any or all of them.

legendary_actions.name: Infernal Glare
legendary_actions.desc: Geryon targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. If the target can see Geryon, the target must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of Geryon until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Swift Sting (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Geryon attacks with his stinger.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
